text: Richard Patrick Tracey JP (8 February 1943 – 19 March 2020) was a British Conservative politician, journalist, presenter, and reporter. He was the MP for Surbiton from 1983 to 1997, and was Minister for Sport between 1985 and 1987. From 2008 to 2016, when he retired, he was a Member of the London Assembly, in which he represented Merton and Wandsworth. He was the Deputy Leader of the Conservative group. Tracey died peacefully at home on 19 March 2020, aged 77.Matthew Maxwell Scott: A tribute to Richard Tracey ==References== Category:1943 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Conservative Party (UK) MPs Category:Journalists from London Category:British television presenters Category:Politicians from London Category:UK MPs 1983–1987 Category:UK MPs 1987–1992 Category:UK MPs 1992–1997 Category:Alumni of the University of Birmingham
title: Richard Tracey
